name: NPR
text: At least 13 people were killed in a stampede at a nightclub in Peru when they tried to escape police who showed up to enforce COVID-19 restrictions on such gatherings. https://t.co/drpdNt6u50

name: NPR
text: Justin Townes Earle, the award-winning singer-songwriter and son of Steve Earle, has died. He was 38. https://t.co/TAivGGZfPH

name: NPR
text: Since a 2018 investigation by NPR led an overhaul of the troubled TEACH Grant program, the Education Department says more than 6,500 teachers have had nearly $44 million in unfair student debts turned back into grants. https://t.co/vJtWhDqA2n

name: NPR
text:
The House approved a bill to:

• infuse $25 billion into USPS
• block any service or operations changes to USPS until at least January
• require USPS to prioritize delivery of all election-related mail
  
But it's unlikely to advance through the Senate.
https://t.co/d37P39jCh5

name: NPR
text: A Black man was in serious condition after being shot several times by a police officer in Kenosha, Wisc., as authorities responded to a domestic situation, in a scene that was caught on video. https://t.co/4pLPvPYu2a

name: NPR
text:
A federal judge on Thursday dismissed President Trump's latest attempt to block a subpoena for his tax records from Manhattan's district attorney.
https://t.co/jOP7jSSuKq

name: NPR
text:
Nearly 40% of voters in North Carolina are under 40. They make up its most racially diverse voting bloc. Several who spoke to NPR said their desire to defeat Trump outweighs their reservations about Biden.

"Trump got to go, that's all I know," one says.  
https://t.co/xGlE6hzDbm

name: NPR
text:
"Donald Trump not only has a higher percentage of political ambassadors, but has a higher percentage of ambassadors who don't seem to be temperamentally or intellectually suited for the work," says a former U.S. diplomat.
https://t.co/C6DoIHtLkj
